p: Traditional isolation methods are more and more frequently replaced by the advanced techniques combining sample preparation, separation, detection, and identification. Application of liquid carbon dioxide (LCO 2) in the range of temperatures from 20 up to 25 Â°C and in the pressure range from 50 to 60 bar, respectively, was for example reported in 1966 for the extraction of hops [ 11, 14]. Stability of the obtained extract was however insufficient and has undergone a chemical change during storage.
